definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Her brother is the king, but she is the effective ruler.
sentences.chinese: 她的兄弟是国王，但她才是实际的主宰者。

sentences.english: You are the master of the Universe.
sentences.chinese: 你是这个宇宙世界的主宰者。

sentences.english: The good paymaster is lord of another mans purse.
sentences.chinese: 精明的掌钱人是他人钱包的主宰者。

sentences.english: And then where is the holiness, which plays the role of a juggernaut to dominate the universe and human being?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这位宇宙和人类的主宰者是何方神圣呢？

definition: a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
set up on high (idiom); not in touch with reality/aloof and remote
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
